Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor management”
Reviews.Author: Andy S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for exploring the city and right in the heart of the nightlife (if that's your thing). Th staff were corteous and helpful, especially as they had received a booking confrimation from 2 parties, so had reserved 2 rooms, but the matter was quickly resolved. The room was a little basic, but functional and suitable for our purposes, although we found 2 single beds instead of the double we had booked. That said the beds were really comfortable. The only problems to note were that the heating system was ineffectual and I had to repair the flush to the toilet cistern twice as it was not working. Whilst they did provide tea and coffe making facilities, they did not provide milk. The biggest issue however was that on checking out, there admininstration system had not noted the correct booking and we were charged Â£120.00 for breakfasts (Â£20 per day per person) that were included in the booking. Even when we produced the booking confrimation we were told we had to pay as it was not on the system and then take it up with our booking agent on our return.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in an excellent location to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LeoTam78
Reviews.Content: Positive: 1) The best location to explore Amsterdam. 2) Clean room and bathroom, with LCD TV and fridge. 3) Very good complimentary breakfast Negative: 1) Internet didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “location is great”
Reviews.Author: AssiW
Reviews.Content: I've at this hotel at the beginning of February 2012, the room was very basic, breakfast was good. the location was the strongest point.

Reviews.Title: “Small entrance - fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillametteRiver
Reviews.Content: The entrance is a small storefront on wonderful Rembrandt Square - tourist central. Fun shops and restaurants on tiny little streets abound. Public transport is easy with Tram #9 passing by every few minutes (have Euros in hand). We took it to Amsterdam Central Station and got on a train to Haarlem to visit Corrie ten Boom Museum (amazing!). Don't get off in Haarlem until you reach their Central Station. Train tickets are purchased at the station. Difficult to find bank, but found an ATM with English at AH Mart. A debit card or VISA or MC is very helpful - American Express. Not so much. There is an Airport - hotel shuttle (16 Eurros) that was very helpful as we had lots of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights on a leisure trip to Amsterdam. Receptionist was professional, efficient, but not excessively friendly. Don't expect service with a smile. Free WiFi in the lobby, but a charge applies in the rooms. One single lift for all of the hotel. Room was spacious, big bed, comfortable mattress, but pillow felt as if it was made of concrete. Asked to receive a feather pillow, but service provided merely another sythetic pillow. At least they tried to find something. Had a room facing the side street next to Rembrandtplein - monstrously loud at night, don't expect to be able to sleep before 5am on a Friday-Saturday night (I had earplugs, did not help much). Parking was available close by, easy to find. Did not have breakfast in the hotel. I would recommend this plans for travellers who look for a certain standard (which it does have), who have no trouble faling asleep, who do not need much service (though I would expect they are able to deliver it) and particularly to those who go to Amsterdam to party - because the location is perfect to party.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, quiet room & perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Skyliner88
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were meant to be staying at NH Schiller, just across the square. But, bizarrely, our booking wasn't on their system, and it took them a good hour to figure out what had happened. We'd booked through Hotels.com, which seemed to really confuse them! We had to send the woman at reception copies of the emails we received as confirmation of the booking, and even on receipt of these they still didn't understand. Anyway, they had no rooms for us, so we were taken to NH Caransa, their 'sister' hotel. It wasn't much of a looker from the outside, and was situated over the top of a bar/cafe. I was a bit disheartened, but I had no reason to be! We were given a choice of a regular or quiet room, and after reading the reviews about noise in the square, decided to go for the quiet room. And that is was! We stayed in room 208, which was small, but perfectly formed - very clean, with a huge, comfortable bed, huge desk, TV, guide books etc. No noise could be heard at all on Friday or Saturday night, and even the air con was fantastically quiet. I was pleased they were able to accommodate us, with no extra charge. Breakfast on both days was delicious! They had pretty much anything you could think of - the sausages and mini-pancakes were great! Lovely dining room, with a balcony overlooking the square. Reception staff were friendly and welcoming, and we were given fresh towels and new toiletries on each day, which I thought was very generous. Overall I can't fault this hotel, and I was actually glad of the mix up come the end of our stay! An ideal location for getting around the city, too - there was no need to use public transport at all, except on the last day when we had plenty of luggage and were exhausted! Would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “we did like it and can recommand it”
Reviews.Author: happyfourGent
Reviews.Content: good hotel with central location - nice, big and clean rooms, good breakfast; when good weather sometimes noisy at night because of the pubs and terraces at the Rembrandt plein, but hotel provides ear guards in the room

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated above the three sisters pub in rembrandtplein square. Its in a central location and is within walking distance of loads of desired tourist attractions. Its only about 10-15 mins walk back to central station and trams go right past the hotel (although we didn't need them). There were just two of us there and we're both in our twenties so we weren't bothered about the noise and the busyness of the square at the weekend. It might be a bit noisy for families but for any groups of friends its ideal. The hotel itself was clean, staff were friendly and the rooms were cleaned every day. The staff also allowed us to use their printer to print boarding passes for our flight home so they were very accomodating. We opted out of breakfast so can't pass comment on the hotel food but there are plenty of places in the square outside to eat. Overall, a good hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER, NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelandGeo
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the hotel itself is very nice. We were initially given a room that was very small. We requested something else, and the staff were very friendly and gave us a different room. The staff were very pleasant and helpful at all times. BUT, the hotel is located right on Rembrandtplein, which is the 2nd most popular square in Amsterdam. We wish we knew this before hand. It was very nice to walk to the restaurants around the square and within a block or so. However, the locals and tourists come and just sit and hang out in the square. They love to visit the "coffee shop" across the square and then smoke their purchases in the square. With it being July, we had to open the window for ventilation. However, it wouldn't have mattered. One night we chose to be hot and get some sleep and closed the window. It still sounded like the party was in our room. The noise is constant until around 1 AM when the restaurants close. If we were lucky, we got a couple of hours of quiet. The noise then started back up again between 4 and 5 AM when the clubs were closing. We would finally get some sleep after 6 AM when the only noise was the very loud street trains and the trash trucks cleaning up the square. Amsterdam young men, who ride motorcycles, find it amusing to rev their motorcycles at 4 AM, which then causes all of the scooter alarms to go off. OMG, one night we actually had around 75 motorcycles from Hells Angels Amsterdam in the square, which brought about 20 police officers with them. Now, on the other hand, if you are a partier, who likes to be in the center of everything, and be about a 10 min walk from pretty much everything, then this is the place for you. Lastly, when you think Internet at this place, think back to the old dial up access days. It is free and they charge for the better service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough, bit far off the beaten track...”
Reviews.Author: Soulman007
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Amsterdam for years so booked a hotel on Dam Square. The hotel itself was clean and well kept but it was a bit of a long walk from Centraal station and all of the sleazy areas that I love to visit.. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were basic but had everything you'd need for a short stay. Top marks for the powerful shower in the en suite and also for the tea/coffee facilities in the room (a bit of a rarity in The Dam). Not sure I'd stay here again, just because of the 10-15 minute walk to the red light district and the shopping but if you want the (many) bars and clubs around Dam Square then it could be a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, medieval internet!”
Reviews.Author: slun1
Reviews.Content: Great location to tour Amsterdam or just chill in the square. Rooms clean but the absence of public stairs worried me. helpful staff but internet was way slow ... frustratingly slow. BUT ... I'd stay there again if they revised the rates downwards.

Reviews.Title: “NH Caransa”
Reviews.Author: BEA111111111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two night with my colleagues in October. Actually I canÂ´t tell much about the hotel, cause we really just slept there. :-) The rooms were nice, bathroom huge, beds very comfortable. The breakfast was served in another NH hotel across the Rembrantsplein, ca 100m, wide range of pastry, cheeses, hams, fruits, yoghurt etc. The best about the hotel is the central location.

Reviews.Title: “A four star disappointment”
Reviews.Author: benzibb
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights. On the positive side: great location and adequately sized rooms The air condition in the rooms is a cruel joke on the guest - impossible to stay in the room during the day. The soaps are 4x4x0.5 and after they are spent you don't get replacement unless you ask for it. Though on the hotel site they promise free internet it is free only in the lobby and only for 30 minutes - you are cut off in mid sentence. The lobby consists of the walkway to the check-in desk and contains one table one sofa and two armchairs The staff is polite but unproffesional - managed to bungle a tour resevation in three different aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Rembrendtplein is the perfect location for nearby sightseeing, close coffeshops, clubs, restaurants and cafes!”
Reviews.Author: kathleen_warren
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Huge block of restaurants and bars surrounding it with nice variety. Every tourist attraction is walkable if you like the outdoors/ making the walk part of your experience. The area gets very loud around the weekend! If you don't want to party in amsterdam, maybe avoid on the weekend. It seems to be a little classier than the red light district, more restaurant oriented- as opposed to sex oriented. The hotel is very comfortable, fairly spacious as a European hotel. Staff was pretty friendly. Love the easy walk after a night of drinking. Smaller crowds than dam square or red light. Very easy to find from anywhere in the town (Follow signs directing to Remprendtplein) Very close to canals. Walkable from train station (approx 15-20 min) Area felt very safe- touristy but not in your face touristy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beezy508
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel stay in years!!! I was pleased at the cleanliness, the staff was extra friendly, i was allowed to check in early also upon arriving 3hrs before check in time! exceptional location!! i just wish the per night $$$ was extremely high!! over all = A-!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very neat, clean, and modern rooms with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sonono
Reviews.Content: the receptionists were very friendly, the room is very clean and neat, a modern style but the room is small. housekeeping is excellent :)

Reviews.Title: “NiCe LoCaTion aNd FrieNdLy staff”
Reviews.Author: DaLaL_ShaNe3a
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip to Amsterdam and I stayed in nh caransa for 12 night am an nh member and I stayed 79 days in many nh hotels 4 and 5 stars nh hotels I booked business twin room for 12 night and because am an nh hotels member they upgrade me from a business twin room to junior suit it was spacious clean with a nice twin bed and a clean and good size bathroom and a balcony with a really nice view over the Rembrandt square the staff was so friendly and helpful they do there best to make u feel like that u are at home all the lady in the front desk was to friendly and helpful specially carola that was her name I guess thanks a lot for making my stay the best I highly recommend this hotel itâ€™s a nice and clean hotel with the best staff and excellent location but maybe its will not be the good choice to stay in summer because there is no air condition just a cool system its look like an air condition but its only a fan its not that cold other than that the hotel is really excellent choice the room is to modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything one needs”
Reviews.Author: olive3cork
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly as described on website, having both its good points and drawbacks! Good points: Rooms cleaned everyday, with clean towels supplied. Even if the door was marked 'do not disturb', housekeepers left clean towels outside the bedroom door. Bathroom was a bit small but was very clean. The location was perfect, about less that ten mins walk from dam square and lots of nice restaurants located nearby. The receptionist staff were very helpful and helped us with directions and local info. Drawbacks: Cleaning staff were banging on the door at about 10am every morning, too early if you want a lie in!! :) Breakfast is a disaster...stay away! it is 20euro for an all you can eat breakfast but very little selection and food itself wasn't great at all! Keep that 20euro in your back pocket for a different restaurant!! :) Would definitely recommend this hotel for the value, the location and the cleanliness of hotel!!! Overall had a very good stay here. Hope this helps! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Igalkz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a hotel in December during the Christmas holidays. Wonderful location in downtown, close to all attractions. Excellent service hotel, rich breakfast. The rooms are clean and tidy. A little too small in size, but I understand that for the center of Amsterdam, it is normal for this price. Excellent price / quality. But the main advantage of this hotel is its friendly staff. Staff responded readily to any questions, help solve any problems and was patient enough. We particularly want to thank the receptionist Carola, her attitude to the guests for us to remain an example and standard of excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a busy area”
Reviews.Author: MarjerBi
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok, but can be very noisy if the window are on the square (Rembrandtplein). The hotel in general is average: service, food, bed, bathroom...no gym.

Reviews.Title: “Service inconsistent, staff rude and untrained”
Reviews.Author: Misstaipei
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for more than 2 weeks. One thing I found is that, from the front desk staff to the breakfast room waitors and cleaning ladies, I've never seen the same face more than twice during my stay. I'll list a few things to explain how they are untrained: Internet: I requested to purchase the wireless internet pass from the reception but the password and login name appeard to be invalid, so I went back to the front desk. They gave me a new one and asked me to retry, and so I did, but again failed. When I went back again, there were few more people with the same problems talking to the reception staff, and this guy just told me, "we have asked the technical people to look into it, hopefully it would be fixed soon." The funny thing is, I later found out that there were small letters of expiration date on the internet pass, so the reason that we can't log in is because all the pass are expired, but of course none of them bothered to check. they just phoned the technical people and made it someone else's problem. Even more funny thing is that the second time I required internet pass, there's a different lady at front desk, again gave me one of the expired internet pass sheet, means the previous guy didn't even bother to pass on this tiny problem to his colleagues. Housekeeping:The room is extrmely dusty. They make the bed and change the towels, but the tables and the closets are very dusty. And they either forgot to give the shampoo or the complimentary instant coffee and tea. Breakfast buffet: You will need to wake up early enough to see the food. Sometimes if I went after 9:00(closed at 10:30), most of the food is gone, especially the pastry. And I think they are very often understaff, 'cause quite a few times I found the tables coverd in crumb. And this morning they didn't even bother to set the table anymore, everyone had to grab their own cutlery and napkin. I actually saw this poor guy got yelled at by the waitress. He asked her for something and she replied impatiently,"Yes, just one moment ok? I am busy with the buffet, yeah?" Several times I was chased after by staff asking me to sign for the bill while I had plate full of food and coffee in both hands. I'm not sure which hospitality school they graduated from but surely this was not what the school taught them? Their breakfast cost 19 euros if it's not included in room price. And the room rate is about 130 per night in summer time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: sonjablu
Reviews.Content: Rooms beautiful, maid service not so good - toiletries, towels and coffee etc not left. Breakfast - pretty bad value for the money but probably due to the fact this hotel does not have its own kitchen and the food brought in from a sister hotel, pretty obvious when the coffee is not 'real' coffee but self service from a Douwe Egbert machine and I saw breakfast being brought over one morning. No bar or lounge facilities in the hotel so not recommended for single travellers. Very noisy rooms from the bars round about, noise went on until 4 in the morning. Does not have the facilities to warrant star rating

Reviews.Title: “Well located, confortable but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoaoF
Reviews.Content: The NH Caransa is located right in the centre of Amsterdam, in Rembrandt place. Nice area if you have some time for tourism as you can walk easily through all the city centre. The hotel is small without any reasonable lobby or social areas (so consider it just for sleeping). Rooms are nice, modern and clean, although by misfortune I always got a room to the back, directed to the air-conditioning engines. Isolation was good in any case and I slept rather well (beds are great). Restaurants & bars are available just on the side of the hotel. The only real "problem" is the price: quite expensive for this kind of hotel. But I think that most options in central Amsterdam are expensive as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loud noise from surrounding bars and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: lbryan21
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the NH Caransa for 3 nights. The hotel rooms were spacious and modern. However, our room faced the square that has a lot of night life. I was kept up all night by the sounds of the neighboring bars and the people outside the hotel. Additionally, we requested a wake up call that we never received. We made a comment to the front desk as the next day we would be traveling and we needed a wake up call to get to the airport on time. We did not receive this wake up call and when we went downstairs, the person working the front desk was sleeping. Overall, the actual hotelroom was nice but the staff and location were not ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - great location, stylish, clean.”
Reviews.Author: RobLench
Reviews.Content: Finding a good hotel at a reasonable price in Amsterdam can be tricky; but here is one. Simple and stylish and very quiet during my stay. Spotlessly clean; a lovely functional hotel. You're never going to spend hours in a hotel in Amsterdam, there's so much to do. But, my room had a comfy bed and looked the part. The view of an extraction pipe was a let down but lots of rooms do have nice views and I didn't ask to switch. This hotel isn't going to blow your socks off but for the price you can do far worse in this city. Everything is geared for the hotel to be a good place to explore Amsterdam from and it does that job perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, spotlessly clean!”
Reviews.Author: Coxiella
Reviews.Content: The NH Caransa is located at the Rembrandtplein which is a nice place for nightlife, cafÃ©s and restaurants. Tram stops right outside the door. The hotel lobby is quite small, but the rooms are spacious, even the bathrooms are huge. Room service was excellent, room was spotlessly clean, there was air condition and flat screen tv. We didnÂ´t have breakfast at the hotel but there are nice cafÃ©s nearby. WeÂ´ve got a great rate via Priceline so for Amsterdam this hotel was a great bargain. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshiregirl76
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, clean room, everything you need even a decent powerful hairdryer. Centrally located walking distance to main attractions Van Gogh Museum, Anne Franks House, Red light district. Friendly helpful staff, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent basic hotel Super spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: KevinMcAllen
Reviews.Content: Spectacular view of Rembrantplein from giant picture windows. Great location. Close to everything you want to do. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were so helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Kowalski19
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, situated in a very nice area of Amsterdam. We found the hotel staff very helpful, the first night there was a lot of 'night life' going on outside. When we asked the staff to move our rooms the next morning-they were more than happy to accommodate. Tip; ask for room 511, 411, 311 etc. this room is off the street. Or, I stayed in 508-a very comfortable room with a nice view! The buffet breakfast was more than we could handle, such a choice of food. Throughout the winter months you may need to walk over to the NH Schiller for brekkie-but that's a doddle! Oh, the tram goes right outside the hotel-couldn't be easier to get to and then get around!!! ****

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Lively location”
Reviews.Author: DG55
Reviews.Content: The NH Caransa is a good quality medium sized hotel, situated on the lively Rembrantsquare. The exterior shows its age, but inside it is very modern and stylish, having recently been refurbished, in keeping with the usual NH standard. Location is good, being relatively central, situated on a square full of clubs and bars, and right next to the tram stop which takes you to Dam square and Centraal Station. It is within walking distance to most of Amsterdam, within 15 minutes to Van Gogh, Anne Frank Haus, Dam Square, and the Red Light District. Staff were helpful and very friendly, which is always a plus. Room had a flat screen TV with a good selection of channels, including BBC 1 and 2 - which is far better than most. There was also a mini bar and wireless internet, although the prices are far far too high - probably being aimed at business travellers. Breakfast is served across the square in the much larger NH Shiller hotel. So if you're considering this hotel, also take a look at NH Shiller.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GerhardFritsch
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Amsterdam a few times and I know how difficult it is to find decent accomodation for reasonable prices in AMS. NH Caransa is by far the best in AMS that I have ever experienced: Great location, clean and spacious rooms, even the bathrooms are of normal size. Furniture is modern and trendy but still very practical, huge flatscreen TV with english, french and german programmes - everything as you expect from a 4 Star hotel. Extremely friendly staff. Will definitely stay there again - its worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Morticiaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Rembrandtplein and the famous nightclub Escape is next door of the hotel. lf you are going to Amsterdam to have fun (which is most of us going for ) , this hotel is the right place to stay. Flower market is few steps away. From the hotel you can walk to all the hot spot in the city , which is very important for me when l am traveling. The hotel has an elevator which is an advantage cause in Amsterdam most of the hotels dont have an elevator and you have to carry your bag up through the tight steps. Our room was close to the elevator hall cause of that at nights it could be noisy. Bathroom was small , but you could find everything there, what you would need. disposable hair brush , shaving kit , tooth brush...etc Room was very clean. Whatever you need they were bringing to the room.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: michaelf100
Reviews.Content: NH Caransa ,located on the Rembrandt square, is an ideal location if you have business in the center of Amsterdam. The abundance of bars, clubs and restaurants in and in close proximity of the square add to the experience of being in Amsterdam. Public transport (trams) are a great way to get around if you donâ€™t feel like walking. Although almost everything is within walking distance. The hotel is self is located between two bars/pubs and can get a little loud if you book a room facing the square. I usually stay during the week and have little or no problems with the noise. The rooms have all been renovated and are tastefully decorated. During all my stays , 5 so far, the rooms have been clean and staff have been most helpful. The bathroom can sometimes be on the small side depending on which room you book. During one of my stays I was given a room at the back of the hotel with shower instead of the usual shower/bath. I didnâ€™t find it a problem as I usually just shower anyway. Internet access (wifi) is hosted by Swisscom and in my opinion is way too expensive. The hotel offers use of the terminal in the lobby but I have never used it and am unable to state the rate they charge. I usually opt for my blackberry for my incidental web browsing. As mentioned in previous reviews the hotel does not have a restaurant or bar. From what I understand these are still being renovated. This means a walk across the square to the sister hotel NH Schiller for breakfast. Itâ€™s not a huge problem but more of a inconvenience, I donâ€™t mind the fresh air and its only a few yards. As far as the hotel bar is concerned, I think youâ€™d be nuts to want to sit at a hotel bar with the abundance of establishments to choose from on the square, again this is just my opinion. The service in the hotel has always been friendly and the staff go out of their way to provide any assistance. I have had problems with bookings (due to problems with my companyâ€™s travel agent and the NH booking system) on more than one occasion but the staff have always done their best to accommodate me. I enjoy staying at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to my friends and co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious, very clean, comfortable - on central square Rembrandtplein.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: True to the standards of the NH hotel chain, the Caransa is modern, extremely clean, spacious and comfortable. A long narrow spartan lobby takes you off the busy and beautiful Rembrandtplein square after a day spent roaming the canals and streets of Amsterdam. Upstairs, the room was far bigger than most in Europe, with large clean modern bathroom and two minimalist beds with fresh new comfortable linens. Our room had a view out onto the Rembrandtplein square! Though the square can get very busy on some nights, thanks to the many bars, cafes and clubs, the windows blocked out the noise. (clearly the hotel designers understood the noise issue) Though lacking any specific charm of an old Amsterdamn hotel, with narrow staircases or odd-shaped rooms, the NH Caransa is a great choice for someone seeking comfort, space and cleanliness amidst the chaotic other charms of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Swan_tim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Friday and Saturday night, and I agree with most comments that some people may find it a bit noisy. However, the square the hotel is located has a brilliant selection of bars and restaurants which suited me prefectly. I didn't find the noise too bad anyway. Good clean hotel, friendly staff and very good price by Amsterdam standards.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, modern choice in heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: GlobalDavidG
Reviews.Content: Very modern, well appointed rooms with big windows- many overlooking Rembrandtplein. Rooms are dark wood and white walls with a couple clever design features. Decent bath and nice common areas with everything you'd expect from a newly renovated property. Nothing is more than a 20 minute walk from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kielders
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel with nice interior, we stayed Monday to Friday and had no problems at all. The room was spacious, clean and with everything you would expect. It was cleaned daily. We had no problems with noise from the square, we were however on the top floor so this may have helped (along with the time of year) The hotel is really well situated in the city with a very central location, and a tram stop right outside. It is within a 15 - 20 mins walk of all the main attractions. The only thing that was a slight negative was that you had to take a walk across the square to the sister hotel for breakfast. However this was literally a minute or so and a bit of fresh air in the morning is always good! The staff were helpful and polite and allowed us to check in early due to the cold weather and held our bags until late on the day of our departure. Overall we were really pleased that we had chosen this hotel and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but lots of noise from the nearby disco!”
Reviews.Author: bartoncls
Reviews.Content: NH Caransa is a modern looking hotel with stylish interior and friendly service. We stayed there at a Saturday night which wasn't a good idea because we could hear the beats from the nearby club so hard that we even could recognize which songs they played. So unless you go partying yourself during the night, don't stay at this hotel at a Saturday or Friday evening.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was nice but the area was incredibly noisy”
Reviews.Author: callum12
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel was told we could not use our debit card and had to leave a cah deposit of 50 euros which wasnt a problem, then when we came to book out (after a terrible night of riot police and noise) we were given back 57 euros, which we assumed was the room rate had gone down. We got back home the next day to a telephone call telling us they had made a mistake and they had given us 8 euros too much which was fair enough and agreed for them to use the debit card that was refused and couldn't be used in the hotel the day before they could now use. when we booked the hotel we booked it for Â£73 when we looked at our account they had taken Â£103. we will never use this chain of hotels again, we had booked on a non-refundable price so we can not understand how they can change the price now and 8 euros does not account for this discrepency.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the 'Heavy Sleeper'”
Reviews.Author: Lillibrooke
Reviews.Content: Just a short weekend stay, turned up early and although the room wasn't ready they stored our luggage for us and when we returned had moved us down a couple of floors, not sure if it was an upgrade but it was a nice room, very clean. Comfortable beds with four choices of pillow, large bathroom. Staff were very polite and helpful. Would have scored excellent had it not been for the noise. Something I was aware of because of the proximity of nightclubs in Rembrant Square. Great location though in the heart of Amsterdam, within 10-20 minutes walking distance of virtually all attractions. So if you are a heavy sleeper or just out partying all night then this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the fleas!”
Reviews.Author: tsatsuli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week and left having a positive opinion for the hotel and its stuff. It's true everybody was friendly, eager to help with every small or big problem that appeared always smiling. But when my 13 months daughter started bearing marks on her body, I couldn't believe that the diagnose would be: flea's bites, from the mattres or the carpet. If you can't be sure for your children's health in a 3 star hotel in one of the most popular cities in Europe today, where can you be? There is no excuse for that, as items that are destined to be used by babes should be sterlized. Shame on everybody responsible for that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shiulee
Reviews.Content: It was a very well located hotel and the room was nice as well.. We were debating between Park and NH. I am glad we chose NH. Though Park is located just opposite the train station, but the area was extremely noisy and unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but NH donÂ´t honor card membersÂ´ points”
Reviews.Author: life43
Reviews.Content: NH CARANSA, AMSTERDAM Pros: The location is great, in Rembrandtplein (very nice indeed), with a tram stop at the door, restaurants all around the square, supermarkets and shops nearby. Even the Flower Market and many interesting places are reacheable by foot. The room is spacious, spotless, with very comfortable beds, easy operating air conditioning, facilities to prepare hot beverages and a good safe. It has pillow menu, good blackout and nice chair and armchair and it is very well insonorized. There was a very good book of short stories as a souvenir. The modern bathroom is spotless, with excellent toiletries, Kleenex dispenser, good make-up mirror with a nice phrase and a great water flow in the shower. The staff is very courteous. The buffet breakfast is very good, though expensive, and it is served in a beautiful restaurant by very kind staff. Cons: There is little space to store clothes. Though the NH is a Spanish chain, there is no Spanish channel and the staff doesnÂ´t speak the language. The worst of all, they donÂ´t honor the points earned by the NH Card to members. Some weeks after being in this hotel we stayed in another NH in Brussels and they didnÂ´t find my points, so I couldnÂ´t take any advantage of this program. I had the same problem in 2005. If you like peace, avoid going on April 30th, the QueenÂ´s Day. We had to remain almost all day long in the room. We could go out early in the morning but after that the streets were full of drunken people; there was no place to walk easily. There is no public transport and everything is closed except bars. In Rembrandtplein there were two stages with strident music. Some people danced climbed to the telephone cabins, others vomited in the street and the floor was full of broken bottles and cans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailorann
Reviews.Content: After reading many great reviews from Trip Advisor, I decided to book the NH Caransa in Amsterdam. The hotel is clean, modern smallish hotel with about 66 rooms. The hotel staff were very friendly and very accomodating. After our long trip, we arrived a bit early and without any hesitation they allowed us to check into our room early to freshen up and relax. We asked the staff a few times to help us with various things and they were always very friendly and accomodating. Excellent service from this hotel. The room was very nice and modern. They looked just like the pictures. The hotel is situated right in the middle of Rembrantplein, the club area of Amsterdam. For the most part this did not bother us, as we live near the entertainment district back home. But one night the crowd was noisy until about 6am! We did not complain, but good to know for next time. Very central and easy walking distance to Leidsplein, Waterlooplein, Central Station and of course the red light district. For the price we paid the hotel was very nice. The hotel shuttle from the airport will drop you in front of the hote for about 13 Euros one way. The hotel is about 15-20 minutes walk from Central station, so I would not advise taking the train from the airport to the hotel if you have a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: louCork
Reviews.Content: We, a group of eight, 4 couples are just back from two nights in this hotel. It was everything that it promised to be. It has a central location with a tram stop just out side the door; the staff was friendly and helpful. We didnâ€™t opt for the breakfast as we felt it was expensive at 18 Euro a head, so we opted to make use of the tea and coffee facilities and get some fruit and fresh pastries at the local shop. The rooms were modern roomy and very clean and the bathroom was mod with extra nice toiletries. We chose this hotel as a work mate had stayed here and told me it was clean and an excellent location. So the price was ok once we knew it was good, at the end of the day you get what you pay for. We bought a 48 hour unlimited tram ticket which we used constantly. Most places are within walking distance. We got the hotel shuttle in from the airport and had pre arranged a price as there was 8 of us. Then the hotel arranged for the shuttle to pick us up on our return to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stepballchange
Reviews.Content: Good points: Very central - about 15 mins walk to Anne Frank's house, 10 mins to Van Gogh museum, flower market practically next door, tram stop outside the hotel. Very clean and comfortable (apparently the hotel had been recently renovated), choice of pillows, loads of great free toiletries, good breakfast. Staff very efficient, obliging and friendly. Bad points: Fairly noisy - right next door to a nightclub (bring earplugs if you cannot sleep unless it is deathly quiet). The small bottle of water in the room costs â‚¬3.50. The windows cannot be opened and mine looked out onto a concrete wall with big metal pipes (but I suppose my room was quieter than those at the front of the hotel). The shower panel in the bathroom didn't stop the water going all over the floor. Tips: There is a shuttle bus which can pick you up from and drop you off at the airport (www.airporthotelshuttle.nl) - it's cheaper than a taxi. Szmulewicz restaurant around the corner at Bakkerstraat 12 is good (small and cosy). If you want to go to Anne Frank's house or the museums - get there early (before 10 am) otherwise the queue is very long.

Reviews.Title: “A great value base!”
Reviews.Author: Jeasey
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I just got back from 3 nights in the Caransa. Everything was great, nothing was 'wow' like a Jacuzzi bath or balcony over the canal, but the rooms were very nice and spacious, lovely bathrooms, spotlessly clean, great location- and when you paid the price we did I would have been very happy with a lot less! I booked the hotel with help from an online comparison site, we paid Â£185 for 3 nights including breakfast (and including Valentine's night) while without breakfast was Â£300! the company assured me this was right, and that this was a special rate the NH hotels sometimes put out (The Schiller and Doelen both had this same price). Breakfast was great, so much choice- fruits, breads cheeses, meats, salad, the usual eggs and bacon, loads of cakes, yogurts, carton drinks and convenient things you can sneak into your bag for later in the day! The toiletries and freebies were very generous, there was a pillow menu and a nice minibar. Ever staff member we met was very polite and friendly, and on arrival we were given a room with two beds pushed together as a double- we asked to see a double room and it was a lot smaller (just like the receptionist had advised us!) so we stuck with the twin. We really couldn't have wanted anything else from a hotel which is so central in Amsterdam- the trams stop literally on the doorstep and although you can hear them at night it's not bad, and it means it's never a hassle to pop back and forth during the day. I couldn't believe how much some pubs and restaurants charge for food (â‚¬26 for a normal steak!) and booze (â‚¬5-6 a pint!) but there was a lovely restaurant round the back of the hotel called Szmulewicz which seemed popular with the locals. The guide book said how tacky the rembrandtplein was, ignore it- it just meant there was lots of choice for bars, shops, trams- ok it might be touristy but when youâ€™re a tourist that can be convenient! Iâ€™d definitely go back again, and recommend it to anyone- save your money on the hotel, youâ€™ll need it for the restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller28
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a fantastic location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room (a single) was a good size - recently renovated. Very clean. I'd definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Caransa is perfect for the money”
Reviews.Author: xtacine
Reviews.Content: Attended IDFA 4 days in Amsterdam. Was booked by the conference staff, 480 euro total with breakfast included. The building looked weird from the outside, but I was pleasantly surprised once inside the room. Room had two beds, nice bedding, good lighting, good desk, nice extra armchair, sparkling bathroom. Drawback:: I'd hate for two people to share this room. There was ZERO CLOSET SPACE. Really. There was ONE DRAWER. You'd need to store all your stuff in your suitcase or on hangers which were on an open rod. There was a minibar with sodas, smoothies and waters, a few Toblerone bars, etc. Modern, efficient, VERY CLEAN, good breakfast buffet with granola, yogurt, fresh fruit, cheese, bread, herb tea, some kind of hot entree (which I never really checked out). Drawback: Wireless Internet in room supplied by swisscom. Ludicrous prices, 17 euro per 24 hour access. Never worked on my PC for some reason, had to go downstairs in the lobby and buy access per minute, although the receptionist was supernice and gave me some free extra time. I was lucky (or unlucky in that the wireless didn't work in my room) because there was only one computer available downstairs. Yeah, I'd stay here again if on business. Zero romance factor though, so unless you're 20 and don't care about anything except your hottie, don't bother going there for a luxurious, sexy weekend. For business - it's very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Toddy1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Caransa this weekend with friends and had a great stay. The rooms are lovely, very modern and immacuately clean. All mod cons - TV, hairdrier etc The location of the hotel is great - surrounded by lively pubs and restaurants and only a two minute walk from the shops. Probably around ten - fifteen mins walk from Dam square. Staff are brilliant, really friendly and very accommodating - there was probably someone different on reception each time we walked thro and they were all great. Price wise it was relatively expensive (325 euros for two nights excluding breakfast) but only compared to UK - everywhere decent in Amsterdam is like that, If getting taxi from station or indeed anywhere in the city, be sure to agree a price first, we got fleeced once or twice. Taxi from station was station was 20 euros and it is no way that far. The only people I would not recommend this hotel is those who want to stay somewhere quiet - the location is very busy and a bit noisy (not horrendous tho) - and if you are a couple who object to sleeping in two single beds made up as a double (altho most places in the Holland are like that). I would return to this hotel and would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: gnasty71
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter (toddler) and I visited Amsterdam in September 2007. We were there for a business conference as well as sightseeing and the conference had a certain set of hotels that we could use so we stayed at the NH Caransa and the NH Schiller (separate review). NH Caransa is right in Rembrantplein. Its literally in the square. You don't really get a sense of this when you visit the NH website. So what does that mean for you? The good is that is a pretty major stop for the trams which are great public transportation in the city. Its also pretty centrally located. About a 20 min walk to Central Station, 20 mins to Leidesplein and Museumplein, very close to Spui. Bad news, there are tons of restaurants, neon lights and a huge TV screen. Think a small New York Times Square. So its bright and noisy. If you are a light sleeper, beware. Or ask for a side street or rear facing room. Its not perfect but its better. Inside, its very new and modern and pretty much looks like the pictures on the NH website. It was surprisingly big (we got a room with two twin beds pushed together) for a european room. The original room we were assigned with a single queen was a bit small so we asked for a room change. I think the room sizes can vary. The room is clean and well decorated. The bathroom is large, new and spacious. Alongside the beds, they have these great reading lights. The project a small light for reading and attached to a metal "snake" cord that you can manipulate to the angle of your choice. The ONLY thing that was strange was the bathtub/shower didn't have a proper shower curtain. It has this glass half door so for most people the water will splatter and the floor can get wet. A very small inconvenience. The room has a built in safe for valuables. Also, given everything else its so modern, the TVs are still the old style tubes but not a big deal. The staff was very friendly and gave my daughter a kid's kit of puzzles and art supplies. Our room fee was still pretty expensive but that is also largely due to the exchange rate these days which is pretty terrible for US travelers. The fee (for us) included free breakfast in the restaurant. The selection was pretty good although the hot food was a bit bland. Still plenty of fruit, cereals, jams as well as your standard eggs, sausages, bacon, etc. I'd consider staying here again as long as our room was a bigger one and not facing the main square. The location is hard to beat and its is well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommend this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: icklep
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a three night stay in this hotel and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I booked the hotel only a few days before going but we still had a lovely room. It was very modern with a mini bar which didn't charge you everytime you moved something which was handy because you could buy your own drinks and put them in the mini bar. Our room was quite small probably because we booked late but it had a lovely window which practically took up the whole of one wall. We were on the third floor at the back of the hotel overlooking houses... being at the back worked out perfectly... it was so quiet even at the weekend... so if you want no noise whatsoever book a room at the back of the hotel. One thing that bugged me was we had no iron or ironing board in the room... I went down to reception and told them and within seconds there was an iron and an ironing board in the room. The air conditioning also was always on I couldn't get it off but it didn't affect us so it was grand. Oh ya one major thing that I think the hotel could easily rectify is to put a full a full lenght mirror in the room... I found this annoying but at least there was one in the lift. The bathroom was very small but it was absolutely spotless and the shower was one of the best I have ever used... very powerful. The bathroom products were amazing there was a hairbrush, a comb, a toothbrush kit, a shaving kit, a sponge, an exfoliating pad, soaps and designer shampoo, conditioner and shower gel. Even if you had just used one thing once they gave you another new one the next day. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel does not have a bar or a restaurant but it really doesn't affect you if you are off all day and night and using the hotel just to relax or sleep. It gives you an excuse to find some bars and restaurants around Amsterdam. After seeing alot of the other hotels I had been thinking of staying in I think the Caransa is the best one for a few reasons... it is modern, spotlessly clean, has great staff, is centrally located, in the best location I think for seeing everything in Amsterdam and it is in a safe area... I felt alot safer walking around here at night than other areas in the city. Also the tram stop is right outside the hotel which is very handy and very cheap... buy a strip card for 6.80 in a shop it works out cheaper than paying everytime you get on. I would definately recommend a trip to the following Artis Zoo, Anne Frank's House, the Ice Bar and the Aussie bar on Rembrant Square (happy hour every day at 5 - 6pm and 10 -11pm, cocktails are only 3 euro and they are gorgeous). We went to the Sea Palace Chinese Restaurant it is very impressive but to be honest the food isn't great and it is quite expensive for what you get... I wouldn't go back there again. Just be careful in the Red Light District of pick pocketers especially around the lanes... we were followed one day. Overall this hotel is brilliant and located in a perfect location... definately worth a stay and Amsterdam is definately worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandra999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over bank holiday in August. Got the connexions hotel shuttle bus from the airport. Drops you right outside for 19.50 euros return trip. Hotel staff very helpful. Room was good - view not good - but if you have a room with a view you also have the noise, as the hotel is located in a busy square with many bars and a couple of disco's. Paid for B&B - but cannot comment on the food as we were never up in time! The bathroom is very small but there were loads of complimentary goodies. Also Tea making and TV and Fridge, safe etc in the room. Free internet access for 15 minutes in reception if you have to check you bank account or emails! The location is fantastic with tram stops right outside the hotel - but a leisurely walk gets you to Dam Square or Singel for the flower market. The hotel staff arranged the shuttle back. All in all a brilliant time!

Reviews.Title: “Claustophobics unwelcome !!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterSue
Reviews.Content: No public staircase! Claustrophobics unwelcome! Arrived at NH Caranza and checked in. I asked Receptionist where the stairs where and she replied that I would have to use the lift. I told her that I was claustrophobic to which she just replied there where no stairs. I enquired about the fire exits to which she said these could not be used without a member of staff . When I asked her what other people did who didn't like lifts she said they didn' t get ' those sort of people ' staying at the hotel. She eventually summoned a memeber of staff to accompany us up the stairs. After looking at the stairs I decided these where unacceptable (I wouldn't have liked to have tried to come down these in the event of a fire) we decided not to stay there. The NH Schiller across the road was fully booked but the NH city centre had a lovely room and very good staircases. Didn't actually stay at the hotel but the receptionist was rude unhelpful and made me feel stupid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation at the NH Schiller, but they were overbooked to they relocated me to this hotel. I could not be happier that they did it. This hotel is modern, fresh, has a helpful staff and great location. The most amazing thing is the staff. They go so out of their way to help. The rooms are for the most part clean, but very functional and comfortable. They are also very modern, definitely recently renovated. The bathroom handouts add to the comfort as well. Although the room was well-sized, the bathroom was pretty tiny. The location is also a great asset. It is in the center of Rembrandt Square, full of resturants and people. Amsterdam is a small city, so you can walk to most tourists spot from the hotel is less than an half hour. If you are lazy like me though, the tram literally stops outside the hotel. It could not be easier. I would without a doubt return to this hotel if i ever return to the amazing place that is Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved A'dam”
Reviews.Author: vanessasfc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there from 6 till 11 of june 2007 and had a great time, the room was huge and clean and the location of the hotel was perfect. The staff could be friendlier, specially the ones serving breakfast. VC Portugal

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT, HIGHLY RECCOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: XLA
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel and it was brilliant. The hotel has had a complete rennovation and everything is new. The staff were excellent as usual and I had no problems durning my stay. The hotel is located in an excellent location and most major tourist attractions are easily accessible. I will deffinately go again. You can get a better deal if you don't book through hotel's own website. GTA hotels has good deals on all NH hotels

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: icorem
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel and value. great location, friendly staff. overall great amsterdam accomodation place.

Reviews.Title: “Great mini break!”
Reviews.Author: whlsarah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the NH Caransa from 10th-13th February and we found that it met our needs very well. As other reviewers have said the hotel itself was under renovation. The rooms have been completed and we were very pleased with the standard of our room. The bed was enormous and we slept very well! Another reviewer mentioned noise from the disco- we were on the second floor and we could hear some music on the Saturday night, however this did not hinder our experience greatly. As the reception/ breakfast room were being renovated we used the brasserie at NH Schiller for our breakfast (our package included breakfast). We found the breakfast to be good- with a lovely range of fresh breads, as well as a selection of hot foods. There was even sparkling wine should you wish! Overall our experience of the hotel was very good and we found the location to be excellent for walking to all the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: nanamill
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in january at the caransa on rembrandtplein with friends. Rooms had been refurbished to an excellent standard, although the public areas at reception and dining area were being refurbished during our visit this had no effect on our enjoyment of the visit and all staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a good location for all sights and restaurants. There is a club next door and we were aware there may be noise but didnt hear any! we ewere on the sixth floor and friends on the third and neither of us were disturbed ( even on the saturday night!)Well worth a visit for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “No peace and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: swetik1
Reviews.Content: + Very friendly staff, warm atmosphere - Our room was too noisy, so we couldn't sleep at night. The biggest problem is that the hotel is situated next to the disco.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Cisnereal
Reviews.Content: At the end of November 2006 I stayed with my partner at the NH Caransa Hotel in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. The receptionists were all very friendly and helpful. Our room was a bit small, but well-kept and clean. Our only dislike was the fact that nothwithstanding the price of our room, we had to pay 20 Euros for 24 hours. And the 24 hours were running even though you didn't log in to internet. The hotel is on the Rembrandtplein, 1 minute walk to the trams and on walking distance to most views in Amsterdam. For gays, the Reguliersdwarstraat, where many gay bars/discos/shops/restaurants are situated, is a comfortable 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel-great location”
Reviews.Author: Dublinadvisor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the NH Carasna and was very happy with the hotel despite it not being our first choice. The location is great and very easily reached by tram from central station. Having said that we did walk to the hotel from central station as it was early, we wanted to stretch our legs and get our bearings. It's located in the very busy Rembrantplein although it never seemed that busy the weekend we were there. The building itself it not much to look at and reception is a little dated and misleading as to the type of hotel! Our room was lovely and on the 2nd floor, not overlooking the square so I can't comment on any possible noise from there. I went prepared though, with ear-plugs as it was a "must" that I sleep on the first night as we were there to take part in the marathon and half-marathon races! The room was immaculately clean and also had tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was a little on the small size but again very clean and well stocked. The shower was very good. The rooms seem to have been modernised as of late and are very tasteful and trendy. As I said before the reception area is of older and more dated decor. The staff were very friendly and efficient. I was sent off to run with complimentary sports drinks and quickly provided with a bag of ice for my weary muscles on my return! The buffet breakfast was fine, the usual cereals, breads, cheese, ham and fruit. There is a plentiful supply of great restaurants in the area away from the more touristy ones around the square. All in all, I was very pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Its an ideal location to explore the city from and really within walking disance of everthing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Caransa!”
Reviews.Author: Mrhreid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of September for a lads holiday to Amsterdam. We had some last minute changes to our booking which the hotel sorted out over the telephone very quickly. The hotel is excellently located on rembrantsplein. It takes about 10 mins max by tram from central station to get there. We were checked in very efficiently and quickly. I found all the staff to be friendly and helpful - happy to book restaurants and taxis whenever needed. Hotel room was excellent size, in top quality state and facilities very good - there's a safe in every room and plenty of storage. Bathroom good size although some of the rooms have frosted glass doors which i always find slightly bizarre. Only critiscism is that rooms at front over looking square can be quite noisy into wee small hours! There's a lot of touristy type bars in the area and its easy to get pretty much anywhere in the city from the location - i.e. museums a 10 min walk away, dam square 10 mins, coffee shop just across the sq..... One thing to note the area can get pretty lively on a Fri and Sat night and there appeared to be a bit of trouble in the area on both these nights (although this was about 2-3am). Hotel is secure though as front doors are locked at night and you gain access by pushing a bell which the night porter answers very quickly. Overall hotel was great and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: KLEINSTER
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel speedily through Expedia we chose the NH Caransa because of its comparable price, modern bedrooms, excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and its central location to Rembrandtplein, a leafy large square filled with cafes, bars and excellent travel connections. Just a short taxi ride from Central Station (8euros) the hotel is situated amongst a row of large cafe bars with ample exterior seating - perfect for drinks and snacks whilst absorbing the laid back atmosphere of the square and ideally located for watching the inhabitants of Amsterdam -indeed the world-stroll or cycle by. The entrance of the hotel is scruffy and outdated in appearance and one could easily mistake it for having read its reviews that the hotel has recently completed its refurbishment. The hallway leading to reception is dated, dimly lit, is mirrored yet quite forbidding for a hotel that boasts it has 4 stars on its front door signage. The three of us had arrived four hours earlier than the requested 14.00hrs check in so we expected to leave our bags safely with the concierge. The check in was not as smooth as it could have been if the hotel had considered employing more than one person to handle telephone bookings, baggage handling, cash handling, settling bills, etc. for the work was clearly too much for one sole employee to handle. Nevertheless the friendly yet flustered multi-tasking receptionist informed us our room was being serviced and would be eventually ready for us circa 14.00hrs. We agreed to sample brunch at one of the external eateries nearby and we quickly fell into and alongside the laid back attitude of the Dutch whilst we absorbed the cafe society ambiance. So when our room had finally been serviced at 14.45hrs it didnâ€™t really seem to matter to us at all! Our bags had been left safely under the stairs with the concierge so we took the lift to the fourth floor where our welcoming (thankfully) refurbished modern twin superior en suite room slept three with a comfortable fold out bed for the third person in our party. The floor to ceiling windows let in a vast amount of light and the room faced out into the square and tram stops below. The buzz of passing trams, excited holidaying Europeans, shoppers, cyclists, dog walkers and partygoers could be shut out with the double glazed windows but we seemed to not mind the noise preferring it combined with the breeze that was offered with the windows open. The beds were extremely comfortable with spotless clean white linen and there was ample room for storage for three persons. The addition of the third bed did not encroach on the room space at all and was (I was regrettably advised) very comfortable to sleep on. The bathroom with shower was clean and modern if a little on the small side for no more than one person could frequent it any one time. We did not use the breakfast service so could not comment on this or the room service that only seemed to be advertising its menus in the lift. The hotel is ideal for its location and we were all content with the modern room and comfy beds if taken aback by the shabby dated hallways and reception areas. It is perfect for exploring Amsterdam and with so many beautiful walkways and canals, street side eateries, excellent shopping and a travel system that so, so easily puts the UK to shame one does not really wish to stay in a hotel room for any long period than necessary for fear of missing out on what beautiful Amsterdam has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: eliger
Reviews.Content: We just come back from Holland, and stayed 7 weeks at the Caransa hotel. We've stayed in many hotels around the world, from 3 to 5 stars, but the Caransa ranks with the best. Not as flashy as some, but very clean, excellent staff who all speak English and at least another language besides Dutch. Breakfast is plentyful with a choice of two restaurants, one at the Caransa, and the other and bigger and very cosy at the Schiller across the Rembrandts Plein, one of the great nightspots in Amsterdam. Nothing but praise for this excellent establishment.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION IN AMSTERDAM”
Reviews.Author: Pendy
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a stay at N H Caransa hotel in Amsterdam.The hotel,staff and location were all excellent.What an enjoyable time we had here and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.The hotel is located right on Rembrandt Square and the bars and entertainment were great.It was our first time in Amsterdam and we are already looking to book again but only in this hotel.A four star hotel at great rates.Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “The suite is worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the top floor suite in May 2006 -- it was perfect. The suite comes with a huge balcony overlooking Rembrantplain -- very peaceful, beautiful at night, and you can see the towers of the city. The room is huge, spacious, and comes with great toiletries. Modern design, great beds, even in the details of the lighting. Only downside is we had no control of the air conditioning, but not a big deal. Has internet access in the hotel, a couch, huge closets. Best part is the LOCATION, you cannot go wrong in Rembrantplain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dinky2
Reviews.Content: Having visited Amsterdam seven times, each in a different hotel, finally we have found one we would return to. Despite signs claiming renovation work in progress, we didn't hear a thing. The hotel room was modern and clean with all of the amenities you would expect from a four star hotel. Our visit was over Easter and the constant supply of chocolate eggs in reception was a nice touch! Only thing that stops us rating the hotel 5/5 was the lack of a full-length mirror in the room, other than that, a great hotel in a great location, we will return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Member8
Reviews.Content: Very good modern hotel, although some renorvation work was being done at the time of our stay (March 2006)and we had to take breakfast at the Schiller Hotel opposite (very good breakfast and vouchers for free drinks to compensate)we would still recommned it. Room was a very good size, very clean and quiet as it was on the side of the hotel. Staff helpfull. Plenty of bars around the area, would highly recommend the food at the Bell Inn Pub opposite. Tram stop right outside the front door for ease of getting about.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Caransa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday evening and checked in very smoothly. Staff were friendly and spoke very good english. We were very impressed with the room as on reading Trip Advisor comments beforehand we were a little apprehensive. They are having some renovations done so we could have breakfast in their sister hotel across the square which was equally lovely. The renovation work was done after 9am on the Saturday and Monday but we were up anyway as we were out doing things so it did not bother us. I would definitely recommend this hotel as its central, modern and clean with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with NH Caransa.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The NH Caransa at the end of Novemeber 2005 with my fiance. We travelled to Amsterdam for a weekend break, and had high expectations of the Caransa. We arrived at the hotel at around 20:00 and were told that the hotel was in the process of being refurbished and were given earplugs! We didn't hear a sound from the builders but instead had the noise of a pub/club underneath until the early hours of the morning. We were allocated a tiny room which was dark, with awful decor, and a small, very draughty window with a view of a wall inches ahead and a fire escape to the left. On a positive note, the hotel reception and our room were both immaculate (apart from another guests empty bottle under the bed). The bathroom was on the small side but spotless, with the usual complementary toiletries. The reception staff spoke excellent English and were very professional. The hotel is in an excellent location, with a tram stop right outside and aproximate 10 minuite walk to the centre. I would probably stay in the area again, but would definately not recommend this hotel to friends or family.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Caransa
HotelInfo.Address: Rembrandtplein 19, Amsterdam 1017 CT, The Netherlands (Formerly Golden Tulip Caransa)
